summary: This bill, the "Disclosure of Engagements with Attorney Law Firms Act of 2025" (DEAL Act of 2025), directs the Comptroller General to report on settlements between the Executive Branch and covered law firms. It defines a "settlement" and outlines specific criteria, including the provision of legal services, the involvement of the Executive Branch in selecting causes, and a value exceeding $1,000,000.  The report aims to determine if any settlements violate the Miscellaneous Receipts Act, focusing on agreements made between February 1 and April 30, 2025.
